quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Men and Wolf
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, john, content. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The nutritional value and vitamin content in soft drinks are generally only this much.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1/10th of the daily requirements

questions.question: Who started the revolutionary group The Sons of Liberty?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Samuel Adams

questions.question: What two presidents were politically at odds throughout their younger lives, but later wrote letters back and forth?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Thomas Jefferson and John Adams

questions.question: Which of these men was not on the committee to write the Declaration of Independence?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Hancock

questions.question: John Paul Jones was the captain of the ship Bonhomme Richard. Who was the inspiration for the name of this ship?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Benjamin Franklin

questions.question: Who did Thomas Jefferson think should have written the Declaration of Independence?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Adams

questions.question: Producing corn syrup is the second largest use of corn in North America; this is the largest.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Feeding livestock

questions.question: Which of these men was called The Swamp Fox?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Francis Marion

questions.question: Wolves are solitary animals, hence the term lone wolf.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: The wolf is a member of the canine family.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which of these men was the commander at the Battle of Cowpens?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Daniel Morgan

questions.question: Refined sugar is an important ingredient in soft drinks. It is known to cause this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cavities

questions.question: Which of the lower 48 states of the USA has the biggest wolf population?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Minnesota

questions.question: The leaders of a wolf pack are called the dominae.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: The average adult wolf weighs between 75 and 125 pounds (35 – 60 kg.)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Pooh and Stories
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, lack, cartoon. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: You can reduce contact with your teeth when drinking soda, by doing this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Using a straw

questions.question: Researches have found a relationship between drinking soda pop and this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kidney stones

questions.question: In one of the stories, Pooh and his friends played a game which became so popular worldwide that each year a World Championship takes places in Oxfordshire. The game is known as this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Poohsticks

questions.question: Pooh describes himself as a Bear of Very Little ...?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Brain

questions.question: Soft drink consumption is said to be a main contributing factor to this problem.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Obesity

questions.question: The setting of the stories about Winnie the Pooh is based in Sherwood Forest, England.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Many soft drinks contain caffeine.  Your body absorbs caffeine more readily from soft drinks than coffee, due to this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Carbonation

questions.question: One of the four pairs (a friend of Pooh - his main characteristic) is wrong. Can you spot it?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tigger - Intellectual

questions.question: Winnie the Poohs name originates from the first thing the son of Poohs creator, Milne said: Poooh!
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Winnie the Pooh was the favorite cartoon character of this city in 2005.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hong Kong

questions.question: The lack of vitamins and minerals in soft drinks causes effects on your skin.  Your skin becomes more prone to this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wrinkles and aging

questions.question: Two of the works of Benjamin Hoff use Winnie the Pooh in a very accessible way in order to explain this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Taoism

questions.question: If you mostly drink soft drinks and no milk, your chances of getting this are increased.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Osteoporosis

questions.question: The nicest thing about the rain is that it always stops. Eventually. This is a quote by Tigger.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: The shortest national anthem is the Japanese one and it is just four verses long.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Country and Movie
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, smith, country. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which country tops the world in plastic surgery procedures?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: USA

questions.question: Men die protecting you. Perhaps they deserve more than your pity is a popular quote from this movie.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Troy

questions.question: The first names of Mr. and Mrs. Smith.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John and Jane

questions.question: Which is the worlds third most populous country?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the USA

questions.question: One of the following celebrities did not co-star along with Brad in Oceans Eleven.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ben Affleck

questions.question: Quentin Tarantino wrote the script for one of these movies, in which Brad played.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True Romance

questions.question: Which is the only country in South America, whose official language is English?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Guyana

questions.question: Dick Clark was the original host of American Bandstand.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: The United Kingdom is both in the top ten for GDP and child poverty.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: How many islands does the country of Indonesia have?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 17,000

questions.question: Just one of the following countries possesses farms.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Andorra

questions.question: How many sheep per person are there in New Zealand?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 12

questions.question: A media mogul acts as a guide to Death, who takes the form of a young man to learn about life on Earth and in the process, fall in love with his guides daughter is the plot outline of this movie.

options.text: The Dark Side of the Sun

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Meet Joe Black

questions.question: In this movie Brad played a boy, sent to a juvenile detention center, where he is physically and sexually abused by four of the guards.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sleepers

questions.question: Which was the first movie Brad Pitt played in?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No Way Out

quizzes.description: Test your nature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Nature, interviews, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A Bugs Life

options.text: Nothings Gonna Stop Us Now - Starship

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Shattered Glass - Laura Brannigan

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Karaoke

questions.question: As long as people are still having premarital sex with many anonymous partners while at the same time experimenting with mind-expanding drugs in a consequence free environment, Ill be sound as a pound! (1997)

options.text: Austin Powers: International Man of Mystery

questions.question: The final American Bandstand show aired in what year?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1987

questions.question: Youll meet someone. Someone very special. Someone who wont press charges.

options.text: Star Wars: Episode V - The Empire Strikes Back
Dr. Strangelove or: How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love the Bomb

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Addams Family Values

questions.question: On a long enough timeline, the survival rate for everyone drops to zero. (1999)

options.text: The Beat of the Live Drum

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fight Club

questions.question: I think everything must go back to the fact I had a very anxious childhood. You know, my mother never had time for me. You know, when youre the middle child in a family of five million, you dont get any attention. (1998)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Antz

questions.question: One mans compost is another mans potpourri. (2000)

options.text: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: How the Grinch Stole Christmas

questions.question: Old age. Its the only disease, Mr. Thompson, that you dont look forward to being cured of. (1941)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Citizen Kane

questions.question: Dick Clark usually does well during his mini interviews with the performers. However he had one of the most difficult ones of his career with this singer. Who was it?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Prince

questions.question: The key here, I think, is to not think of death as an end. But... but... think of it more as a very effective way of cutting down on your expenses. (1975)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Love and Death

questions.question: All but one of the performers on American Bandstand did not sing live, who was it?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: B. B. King

questions.question: American Bandstand was shot in Philadelphia the whole time it was on the air.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: American Bandstand first premiered simply as Bandstand, in what year?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1952

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Actor and Movies
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, actor, making. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In Shrek 2, when the page comes to invite Fiona and Shrek to Far Far Away, he is announced by trumpeters. Before being smacked in the head, the last trumpeter plays the theme song of what TV show?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hawaii Five-O

questions.question: If a golden era of American film making existed, when would it have been, judging by the Top Ten list of the American Film Institute?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1930-1945

questions.question: Who directed the only 1990s film included in the AFI Top Ten List?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Steven Spielberg

questions.question: Who was the only actor to play the leading role in two movies of the AFI Top Ten List?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Marlon Brando

questions.question: Which of these Top Ten AFI films received the fewest major awards and nominations in its time?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Singin in the Rain

questions.question: Rough-hewn, cigar-smoking Sam Spiegel was the only major producer who had a hand in making two of the Top Ten movies according to the American Film Institute. Which are they?

options.text: Lawrence of Arabia and Gone with the Wind
Gone with the Wind and On the Waterfront
On the Waterfront and Lawrence of Arabia

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: On the Waterfront and Lawrence of Arabia

questions.question: Which are the only two musicals on the Top Ten list of the American Film Institute?

options.text: South Pacific and West Side Story
The Wizard of Oz and Singin in the Rain
The Wizard of Oz and Gigi
Singin in the Rain and South Pacific

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Wizard of Oz and Singin in the Rain

questions.question: Of these four directors who filmed some of the Top 10 AFI American films, which one was NOT an American citizen?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: David Lean

questions.question: I would rather have had one breath of her hair, one kiss from her mouth, one touch of her hand, than eternity without it. (1998)

options.text: The Best Years of Our Lives

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: City of Angels

questions.question: Who directed two of the Top Ten American movies released in the same year?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Victor Fleming

questions.question: Which one of the AFI Top Ten films had the most disappointing return at the box office?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Citizen Kane

questions.question: This character from the animated movie Shrek 2 is the bartender at the Poison Apple.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Ugly Stepsister

questions.question: Hearts will never be practical until they are made unbreakable... (1939)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wizard of Oz

questions.question: Which actor delivered the line Heres looking at you, kid, one of  the best known, oft-repeated lines in American film dialogue?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Humphrey Bogart

questions.question: What is the relation between the Fairy Godmother and Prince Charming in the 2004 movie Shrek 2?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: She is his mother

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Year and World
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, kilometres, country. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The Earth is in the center of the solar system?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Is Australia the biggest island in the world?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No

questions.question: Which of the following events did not occur in the year 1986?

options.text: The Space Shuttle Challenger exploded 74 seconds after liftoff.
ALF, for  Alien Life Form  , landed on our television screens.
The Statue of Liberty celebrated her 100th Birthday, in a gala, fireworks-studded event.
George Michael captured the airwaves, not with a shout, but with a mere Careless Whisper.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George Michael captured the airwaves, not with a shout, but with a mere Careless Whisper.

questions.question: On October 19, 1987, the U.S Stock Market took a severe one-day crash, which affected other international markets as well.  This grim day in the financial world, came to be widely known as this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Black Monday

questions.question: At the end of the movie Shrek 2, Puss invites Donkey to go to what place?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Kit-Kat Klub

questions.question: What is the name of the potion that Donkey and Shrek take in the animated movie Shrek 2?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Happily Ever After

questions.question: Which one of the following is not a Nintendo handheld device?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nintendo UP

questions.question: The sinking of which British ocean liner played a role in the United States entry into World War I?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lusitania

questions.question: In this year of the 1980s:  The disco ball finally dropped and faded from the dance floor.  We wore our Izods with the collars turned up.  Blondie wanted us to call her,  and Robin Williams proved he was strong to the finish  in the movie Popeye.  What year was it?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1980

questions.question: This railroad, built between 1891 and 1916,  is 9,288 kilometres (5,772 miles) long and spans 8 time zones.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Trans-Siberian railway

questions.question: All of the following took place in the same year. The VietNam War Memorial was dedicated in Washington, D.C.  Epcot Center opened in Orlando, Fla.  A game called Trivial Pursuit appeared on the market, and at the box office,  Steven Spielbergs movie ET- the Extra Terrestrial captured our hearts and minds by storm.  What year was it?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1982

questions.question: You have a time machine which transports you into the past. When you arrive there, people all around you are saying: Ive fallen, and I cant get up!  You turn on the T.V. to find 40 bands performing for 16 hours in a world concert event called Live Aid.  You finally say, Enough, already! and head down to the local cineplex, only to find Back to the Future ( what else? ) advertised on the marquee!  You turn to your guide who comes with the time machine and say, Ive had about all I can take of 1983!  Is this the correct year youve found yourself in?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No

questions.question: This country, which used to be known as Ceylon, was referred to as The Pearl of the East .
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sri Lanka

questions.question: What is the chemical symbol of Potassium?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: K

questions.question: In this landmark year during the 1980s,  the following events occured:  An assasination attempt was made on  ( Then)  President Reagans life.  MTV, 24 hour Music Television  debuts with  The Buggles Video Killed the Radio Star.  Prince Charles and Lady Diana Spencer are wed in a gala ceremony.  Kim Carnes smash hit single Bette Davis Eyes wins Record of the Year.  Which year was it?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1981
